Description: The Securities and Exchange Commission announced a settlement of allegations that Capital One Financial Corporation and two senior executives understated millions of dollars in auto loan losses incurred during the months leading into the financial crisis.

The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ordered Capital One Bank (U.S.A.), N.A. to refund approximately $140 million to two million customers and pay an additional $25 million penalty. This action resulted from a CFPB examination that identified what the agency called deceptive marketing tactics used by Capital One's vendors to pressure or mislead consumers into paying for add-on products such as payment protection and credit monitoring when they activated their credit cards.
The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency announced a $35 million civil money penalty against Capital One Bank (USA), N.A., for violations of section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act.
Agency: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency

Description: Capital One N.A. and Capital One Bank (USA) N.A. have agreed to pay approximately $12 million to resolve a lawsuit by the Department of Justice alleging the companies violated the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act (SCRA). The settlement covered a range of conduct that violated the protections guaranteed service members by the SCRA, including wrongful foreclosures, improper repossessions of motor vehicles, wrongful court judgments, improper denials of the 6 percent interest rate the SCRA guarantees to service members on some credit card and car loans and insufficient 6 percent benefits granted on credit cards, car loans and other types of accounts.

Agency: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency
Office of the Comptroller of the Currency

Description: The Justice Department filed a settlement agreement that resolved allegations that Chevy Chase Bank F.S.B. engaged in a pattern or practice of discrimination against qualified African-American and Hispanic borrowers in its home mortgage lending from 2006 through 2009.

Private Litigation Case Title: Mills et al v. Capital One, N.A.
Beatty v. Capital One Financial Corporation et al

Agency: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency

Description: The U.S. Trustee Program announced that Capital One Bank (USA) N.A. would refund approximately $2.35 million to consumers in bankruptcy (or their bankruptcy estates) for amounts received by Capital One as a result of erroneous claims it filed in bankruptcy cases for debts that previously had been discharged.

Discover, Capital One and HSBC agreed to pay a total of $2.235 million to a consumer-protection fund in settlement of allegations they misleadingly marketed payment-protection plans and other add-on products.
engaging in unsafe or unsound practices, including those relating to information security
Agency: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency

Description: The case involved allegations that Capital One and three collection agencies used automated dialing equipment to place unwanted calls to customer cellphones. The total settlement was $75.5 million. The three collection agencies paid about $2.4 million of the total.
Private Litigation Case Title: In Re: Capital One Telephone Consumer Protection Act Litigation

Agency: Treasury Department Financial Crimes Enforcement Network
